section.p:
Sinhagad is one of the closest forts around pune and the best one for all those who want to try trekking.
The best part of this is there is clearly defined trek trail (path) right from the beginning till the top along with few short cuts here n there.
You can also reach the fort by road though the road is pathetic and motor cycle drive is risky.

Sinhagad is located at approx 30 KMs from Shivajinagar Bus stop/Rly station. Reaching Sinhagad
is pretty straight forward. From Shivajinagar or corporation or Pune railway station go towards Karve road---> Null stop ---> Swargate and hit Sinhagad Road.

Once on Sinhagad road, keep going straight for about 20Kms. In between you will come across diversion
for Panshet, keep left for Sinhagad. Then you will find another diversion, the left turn takes you to the top by road. Keep right and continue to reach village at the base of the Sinhagad. You can park vehicle there, and start trekking up. Usually Saturday & Sunday lot many enthusiasts trek Sinhagad. On the way to the top you will find localites selling refreshments.

There is one small temple in between which indicates half of the way of trek. With normal, first time
doers speed; it will take max 1Hr 30 Mins to reach the top.

Though the fort is spoiled, it still provides a very nice view of the surrounding places from the top & the
environment during Rainy season is just awesome. It attracts lot many tourists regularly &favorite destination for adventurous college goers, professionals & families. You will find localites serving maharashtrian delicacies.

p.pre:
Some Specs :)
Trek Type: Easy
Total Distance: Approx 2-3 KMs one side.
Travel time from Shivajinagar: Approx 1Hr
Quality of the Road: last 2-3 KMs is pathetic otherwise manageable. Good at few places.
What not to be missed: Good Shoes as there is lot of gravel & big stones on the trek path.
